thread.title: Ground News - AAA warns of dangers of driving hungover
thread.title_full: Ground News - AAA warns of dangers of driving hungover

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - AAA warns of dangers of driving hungover
text:
Summary by Ground News AAA East Central wants to remind motorists that driving with a hangover can impair one's ability to safely maintain control over a vehicle. It can take between 75 to 90 minutes for the body to eliminate the alcohol contained in one standard-sized drink. According to the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism, hangover symptoms peak when the blood alcohol concentration in the body returns to near zero. Share menu More

wtaj.com Center High Factuality AAA warns of dangers of driving hungover PENNSYLVANIA (WTAJ) – As people all across the state get ready to celebrate the coming of the new year, AAA is reminding drivers that intoxication doesn't end the morning after the celebration. Many Pennsylvanians are aware that state legislation dictates that a driver can be charged with DUI if they operate a motor vehicle with a blood alcohol content of .08% or higher. However, drivers with a BAC of less than .08% can also face DUI charges if…
